abstract: Intel Software Guard Extensions (\kw{SGX}) provides a trusted execution environment (\kw{TEE}) to run code and operate sensitive data.\kw{SGX} provides runtime hardware protection where both code and data are protected even if other code components are malicious.However, recently many attacks targeting \kw{SGX} have been identified and introduced that can thwart the hardware defence provided by \kw{SGX}.In this paper we present a survey of all attacks specifically targeting Intel \kw{SGX} that are known to the authors, to date.We categorized the attacks based on their implementation details into 7 different categories.We also look into the available defence mechanisms against identified attacks and categorize the available types of mitigations for each presented attack. (Less)
